alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 3:01PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM SUNDAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY FROM NINILCHIK SOUTH TO HOMER... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. North to East winds gusting 25 to 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula, from Ninilchik south to Homer. * WHEN...From 9 AM Sunday to 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibilities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will develop Sunday morning, then intensify Sunday afternoon as winds strengthen. The worst conditions are expected Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. Somewhat warmer temperatures will arrive Sunday evening, but there is uncertainty in whether it will warm enough to cause precipitation to mix with or change to rain. The most likely place to see some rain is in Homer near sea level.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
